pull.title: qa: Add missing syncwithvalidationinterfacequeue to tests
pull.body: Fixes intermittent travis failures with those tests caused by a missing flush of mempool txes to the wallet.

verification.payload:
tree a484c2b4c249c96ea79d7a181092998fb82ee667
parent 598a9c4e4dcd03c6d80fba005de729a6a3aeba7e
author MarcoFalke <falke.marco@gmail.com> 1516288594 -0500
committer MarcoFalke <falke.marco@gmail.com> 1516894295 -0500

qa: Add missing syncwithvalidationinterfacequeue to tests

events.message: qa: Add missing syncwithvalidationinterfacequeue to tests

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -66,16 +66,17 @@ def run_test(self):
 
         self.log.debug("Stop-start the nodes. Verify that node0 has the transactions in its mempool and node1 does not. Verify that node2 calculates its balance correctly after loading wallet transactions.")
         self.stop_nodes()
+        self.start_node(1)  # Give this one a head-start, so we can be "extra-sure" that it didn't load anything later
         self.start_node(0)
-        self.start_node(1)
         self.start_node(2)
         # Give bitcoind a second to reload the mempool
-        time.sleep(1)
-        wait_until(lambda: len(self.nodes[0].getrawmempool()) == 5)
-        wait_until(lambda: len(self.nodes[2].getrawmempool()) == 5)
+        wait_until(lambda: len(self.nodes[0].getrawmempool()) == 5, timeout=1)

@@ -66,16 +66,17 @@ def run_test(self):
 
         self.log.debug("Stop-start the nodes. Verify that node0 has the transactions in its mempool and node1 does not. Verify that node2 calculates its balance correctly after loading wallet transactions.")
         self.stop_nodes()
+        self.start_node(1)  # Give this one a head-start, so we can be "extra-sure" that it didn't load anything later
         self.start_node(0)
-        self.start_node(1)
         self.start_node(2)
         # Give bitcoind a second to reload the mempool
-        time.sleep(1)
-        wait_until(lambda: len(self.nodes[0].getrawmempool()) == 5)
-        wait_until(lambda: len(self.nodes[2].getrawmempool()) == 5)
+        wait_until(lambda: len(self.nodes[0].getrawmempool()) == 5, timeout=1)
comments.body: We don't want to `sync_mempools`, but check that there are exactly 5 txs in the mempool. (Hopefully the ones that were there on shutdown)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -59,6 +59,7 @@ def run_test(self):
         self.start_node(0, ["-persistmempool=1", "-zapwallettxes=2"])
 
         wait_until(lambda: self.nodes[0].getmempoolinfo()['size'] == 1, timeout=3)
+        self.nodes[0].syncwithvalidationinterfacequeue()  # Flush mempool to wallet
 
         assert_equal(self.nodes[0].gettransaction(txid1)['txid'], txid1)
         assert_equal(self.nodes[0].gettransaction(txid2)['txid'], txid2)
comments.body:
For the reviewer, the issue that it fixes here is: `JSONRPCException: Invalid or non-wallet transaction id (-5)`

I remember that we saw those on travis, but I fail to locate a log with that error.
